snippet: A raft of federal and state laws impose post-conviction restrictions on a shockingly large number of Americans.
abstract: Editorial calls for the repeal or revision of thousands of federal and state laws that impose post-conviction restrictions on a shockingly large number of Americans, many of whom committed only minor crimes; cites report by the National Assn of Criminal Defense Lawyers saying that these restrictions can trigger severe penalties that continue long after punishment is complete.
lead_paragraph: A raft of federal and state laws impose post-conviction restrictions on a shockingly large number of Americans.
